reviews.text: I don't see how anyone can say this isn't a perfect film. The story is tight, it had some strong emotional beats, and the voice acting is spot on.
reviews.author: Justin Brown

reviews.text: This is an animation classic. I love rewatching this from start to finish. It's impact on cinema is undeniable.
reviews.author: Brandon Collins

reviews.text: John Lasseter has delivered a great adventure story that will not only entertain children but can also be enjoyed as a jokey parable by adults.
reviews.author: Tom Hutchinson

reviews.text: Children must eventually outgrow their toys and it’s this existential fear that informs the animated film. Even as its characters worry about getting left behind, the movie is a perfectly preserved snapshot of childhood, a time gone by.
reviews.author: Gayle Sequeira

reviews.text: Despite the animation not holding up, Toy Story is a flawless movie. The writing and characters are amazing.
reviews.author: Korey Coleman

reviews.text: You don't have to be a kid to enjoy it, just have a sense of humor.
reviews.author: Sheila Reid

reviews.text: ... a tight, inventive script that balances strongly etched characters with a tremendous sense of play, and brings it to life with vividly realized characters.
reviews.author: Sean Axmaker

reviews.text: Whenever watching the film, an eternally charming account of the world of toys, imagine that the story told is that of Pixar, the little company who proved, both through their own story and their film, the infinite possibility of imagination.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: I always look back to Toy Story as the match that lit my movie-loving fuse.
reviews.author: Cory Woodroof

reviews.text: We have seen the future of cartoons, and its name is Toy Story.
reviews.author: Margaret A. McGurk

reviews.text: An unforgettable, groundbreaking, absolutely winning masterpiece.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: Toy Story takes a number of surprising turns, and though I didn't fall in love with it -- there's a lot of routine clobbering, scrambling, and zooming about -- I remained interested and happy until the end (and children, I think, will adore it).
reviews.author: David Denby

reviews.text: Toy Story remains the humanistic, vital film that created the mold for such classics as Finding Nemo and WALL-E.
reviews.author: David Harris

reviews.text: Toy Story (1995) is the first completely computer-generated, animated feature film. The visuals were entirely generated from computers, creating a wonderfully-realistic 3-D world with lighting, shading, and textures...
reviews.author: Tim Dirks

reviews.text: This eighty minutes are an endless succession of novelties. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sergio Benítez

reviews.text: If you haven't seen the original in some time, perhaps for fear that it won't hold up compared to the later, sleeker releases from Pixar, it's worth rediscovering its pleasures.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: [Tom] Hanks doesn't just speak lines, he gives a performance.
reviews.author: David Baron

reviews.text: [Toy Story] gives us some of the best characters ever in film.
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: All great animated films, certainly those aimed at youngsters, seem to subtly lament the transience of the magic of childhood, and Toy Story certainly fits in that lineage.
reviews.author: PJ Nabarro

reviews.text: With "instant classic" written all over it, Toy Story, the first full-length feature entirely composed of computer-generated animation, is a visually astounding, wildly inventive winner.
reviews.author: Michael Rechtshaffen

reviews.text: The rivalry between Woody the cowboy and Buzz the astronaut is worked out as a direct parallel to any other family quarrels and it is this sense of oneness that gives the film its kick.
reviews.author: Derek Malcolm

reviews.text: To an entire generation of filmgoers, it just might represent the most significant leap in storytelling that they will ever see...
reviews.author: Shaun Munro

reviews.text: Pixar classic is one of the best kids' movies of all time.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: Apesar de representar um imenso avano tecnolgico, a fora do filme reside no carisma de seus personagens e no charme de sua histria.
reviews.author: Pablo Villaça

reviews.text: When Woody perks up in the opening scene, it's not only the toy cowboy who comes alive - we're watching the rebirth of an art form.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: Introduced not one but two indelible characters to the pop culture pantheon: cowboy rag-doll Woody (Tom Hanks) and plastic space ranger Buzz Lightyear (Tim Allen). [Blu-ray]
reviews.author: Peter Canavese

reviews.text: it is easy to see how virtually everything that is good in animation right now has some small seed in Toy Story
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: Though some of the animation seems dated compared to later Pixar efforts and not nearly as detailed, what's here is done impeccably well.
reviews.author: James Plath

reviews.text: Perhaps the film is meant as a pre-emptive sop to any resistance to a new medium.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: Time has been kind to it, and future years I imagine will still be kind; a classic is forever.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: I think I speak for all adults and kids when I say I can't wait for playtime
reviews.author: Amy Nicholson

reviews.text: So ingenious in concept, design and execution that you could watch it on a postage stamp-sized screen and still be engulfed by its charm.
reviews.author: Derek Adams

reviews.text: Turns out the real magic is nothing to do with technology: it's in the words, the voices, the story. But then, a child could have told you that.
reviews.author: Matt Glasby

reviews.text: Its lightness of touch has not diminished, nor has its near-miraculous kidult-fusion humour.
reviews.author: Andrew Pulver

reviews.text: The 3-D viewing doesn't make much difference...but it is a joy to see these superb films back on the big screen, even after dozens of DVD viewings.
reviews.author: Tom Charity

reviews.text: It doesn't enhance the experience, because the film's timeless appeal is down to great characters and wonderful storytelling; a classic that doesn't need goggles or gimmicks.
reviews.author: Cosmo Landesman

reviews.text: As such Toy Story in 3D is never overwhelming. Nor is it tedious, as many recent 3D vehicles have come too close for comfort to.
reviews.author: Adam Woodward

reviews.text: The fresh look serves the story and is never allowed to overwhelm it, leaving a beautifully judged yarn to unwind and enchant a new intake of young cinemagoers.
reviews.author: Tim Evans

reviews.text: There's no denying 3D adds extra texture to Pixar's seminal 1995 buddy movie, emphasising Buzz and Woody's toy's-eye- view of the world.
reviews.author: Neil Smith

reviews.text: If anything, it feels even fresher, funnier and more thrilling in today's landscape of over-studied demographically correct moviemaking.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: If you haven't seen it for a while, you may have forgotten just how fantastic the snappy dialogue, visual gags and genuinely heartfelt story is.
reviews.author: Grant Lauchlan

reviews.text: The two films and the 10-minute intermission run just over 3 hours, bit much for the little ones who find sitting still that long agonizing.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: The 3D revamp adds an intriguing new dimension to an already wonderful film that's both genuinely engaging and laugh-out-loud funny.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: A magnificent film, created with a then unproven playful spirit that merges broad cartoon antics with an endearing eye toward nostalgia -- the heartbreaking years when wonder turns to knowledge and maturation.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Colorful and witty...the mixture of action and humor proves as irresistible as ever.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: Like the transcendent long shot of Buzz and Woody soaring as one, Toy Story does the impossible in casting us up.
reviews.author: Rob Humanick

reviews.text: The year's most inventive comedy.
reviews.author: Richard Corliss

reviews.text: A winning animated feature that has something for everyone on the age spectrum.
reviews.author: David Ansen

reviews.text: The film sports a provocative and appealing story that's every bit the equal of this technical achievement.
reviews.author: Leonard Klady

reviews.text: A children's film that has real staying power.
An entertaining computer-generated, hyperrealist animation feature (1995) that's also in effect a toy catalog.
reviews.author: Jonathan Rosenbaum

reviews.text: As Lion King did before it, Toy Story revived the art of American children's animation, and ushered in a set of smart movies that entertained children and their parents. It's a landmark movie, and doesn't get old with frequent repetition.
reviews.author: Michael Booth

reviews.text: Hilariously funny, sweet, smart, utterly enchanting look at the secret world of toys.
reviews.author: Betsy Bozdech

reviews.text: The film will probably be more fully appreciated by adults, who'll love the snappy, knowing verbal gags, the vivid, deftly defined characters, and the overall conceptual sophistication.
reviews.author: Geoff Andrew

reviews.text: Absolutely stunning and immensely enjoyable.
reviews.author: Michael Dequina

reviews.text: Just perfect.
reviews.author: Caroline Westbrook

reviews.text: Remains a groundbreaking work in the field of animation, and is still a wonderfully entertaining film.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: My 2-year-old runs around yelling, 'Buzz Lightyear to the rescue!' If that's not a testament to the power this movie has to connect to children, I don't know what is.
reviews.author: Kevin Carr

reviews.text: You wanna know what real "movie magic" looks like? Rent yourself the entire Pixar collection and try not to spend the next eight hours grinning from ear to ear.
reviews.author: Scott Weinberg

reviews.text: A return to the inspiration and genius that powered the old Disney classics. In some ways, its even better than the classics. This film is innovative AND it has a memorable, unpredictable, interesting story.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Overstreet

reviews.text: Moviemaking alchemy — a breathtakingly perfect blend of wide-eyed childhood wonder and wry adult humor, yesteryear nostalgia and eye-popping novelty.
reviews.author: Steven D. Greydanus

reviews.text: Many movies lose their luster over time. Toy Story just gets better with age.
reviews.author: Matt Norris

reviews.text: Children will enjoy a new take on the irresistible idea of toys coming to life. Adults will marvel at a witty script and utterly brilliant anthropomorphism.
reviews.author: Janet Maslin

reviews.text: A film of such striking individuality and uncompromising precocity that I left the theater thrilled with the knowledge that I had just witnessed cinematic history.
reviews.author: Jeanne Aufmuth

reviews.text: A good holiday movie for kids and adults. Although the story is easily understood by kids, there are plenty of jokes and innuendos that will sail right over most kids' heads.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: Revolutionized animation, and had a great story, to boot!
reviews.author: Alex Sandell

reviews.text: Captivating animated film that will win the hearts and minds of all who see it.
reviews.author: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat

reviews.text: The premise is brimming with possibilities -- and none go unfulfilled.
reviews.author: Christine James

reviews.text: The animation is dazzling, but the movie at heart has the simple charm of kids' puppet show.
reviews.author: Eleanor Ringel Cater

reviews.text: Shot through with an exuberant and enviable sense of its own brilliance, Toy Story will continue to impress long after its technical virtuosity has been upstaged.
reviews.author: Nick Hilditch

reviews.text: Although its computer-generated imagery is impressive, the major surprise of this bright foray into a new kind of animation is how much cleverness has been invested in story and dialogue.
reviews.author: Kenneth Turan

reviews.text: Disney's witty, wondrously imaginative, all-computer-generated cartoon is far and away the best of the new holiday movies in town.
reviews.author: John Hartl

reviews.text: Besides the eye-popping look of the movie, Toy Story offers a good tale told with zest and humor, which is a roundabout way of saying you'll believe those toys are real.
reviews.author: Liz Braun

reviews.text: Disney's first computer-made animated feature is a 3-D eye popper.
reviews.author: Susan Stark

reviews.text: Adult viewers also will have fun -- and not only because of the witty writing or the nostalgic trip back to the toy chests of our past.
reviews.author: Jack Garner

reviews.text: stretches your mind creatively to look at inanimate objects with a new respect.
reviews.author: Steve Rhodes

reviews.text: Pixar has made a charming movie carrying their current plot concepts and animation techniques to what appears to be about the limit. Toy Story is a lot of fun.
reviews.author: Mark R. Leeper

reviews.text: Cute, inventive, entertaining little toy adventure for young and old alike.
reviews.author: JoBlo

reviews.text: Sheer delight, exhilarating and breathtaking.
reviews.author: Bryant Frazer

reviews.text: The film will intoxicate children and charm the parents in their company.
reviews.author: Barbara Shulgasser

reviews.text: The wizards at Pixar and Disney have created a film that is unlikely to be forgotten in the next few years.
reviews.author: Christopher Null

reviews.text: In fact, there isn't a funnier, faster-paced movie around, nor one that is more visually arresting.
reviews.author: Chris Hicks

reviews.text: The script, by Lasseter, Pete Docter, Andrew Stanton and Joe Ranft, is filled with clever gags that keep the two heroes at each other's throats and the plot on fast- forward.
reviews.author: Peter Stack

reviews.text: The result is a visionary roller-coaster ride of a movie.
reviews.author: Roger Ebert

reviews.text: Technically, Toy Story is nearly flawless.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: The one big negative about Toy Story involves Disney's overcommercialization.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: Toy Story is long on sentiment and short on story; but has anyone ever complained? Surely not when the characters are so appealing and the visuals so extraordinary.
reviews.author: John J. Puccio

reviews.text: Computer generated cartoon fun!
reviews.author: Madeleine Williams

reviews.text: It's a nice change of pace to see the studio draw magic from this modern tale about ordinary 20th-century kid Andy and his eager-to-please playthings.
reviews.author: Rita Kempley

reviews.text: John Lasseter and his compu-teers have tethered their sky's-the-limit wizardry to a typical Disney tale of wandering and redemption. After a frantic grab-ya opener, this buddy yarn is as engagingly simple as its technology is mind-boggling.
reviews.author: Susan Wloszczyna

reviews.text: Thanks to Pixar's inherent wit, story sense and unerring ear for voice casting, its original charm and delight are intact.
reviews.author: Jim Lane

synopsis: Woody (Tom Hanks), a good-hearted cowboy doll who belongs to a young boy named Andy (John Morris), sees his position as Andy's favorite toy jeopardized when his parents buy him a Buzz Lightyear (Tim Allen) action figure. Even worse, the arrogant Buzz thinks he's a real spaceman on a mission to return to his home planet. When Andy's family moves to a new house, Woody and Buzz must escape the clutches of maladjusted neighbor Sid Phillips (Erik von Detten) and reunite with their boy.
